sentences.en: Hawthorne attempts to dissociate himself from the headlong calamity which he, too, records.
sentences.cn: 霍桑企图将自己与他所描写的灭顶大灾分开.

sentences.en: He has failed to dissociate himself clearly and unambiguously from the attack.
sentences.cn: 他未能干净利落地同那起攻击事件撇清关系。

sentences.en: I dissociate myself from everything he has said.
sentences.cn: 我和他所说的一切无关.

sentences.en: I want to dissociate myself from my companions.
sentences.cn: 我想要与我的同伴断绝关系.

sentences.en: I wish to dissociate myself from those views.
sentences.cn: 我想表明我本人是不赞成那些观点的.

sentences.en: I wish to dissociate myself from what has just been said.
sentences.cn: 我要否认与刚刚说的话有关.

sentences.en: It is difficult to dissociate the man from his position.
sentences.cn: 一想到这个人,就很难不联想起他的职位.

sentences.en: It is getting harder for the president to dissociate himself from the scandal.
sentences.cn: 总统越来越难摆脱这一丑闻了。

sentences.en: It is not possible to dissociate art from morality, politics and religion.
sentences.cn: 不可能把艺术和道德 、 政治和宗教分离.

sentences.en: It is often difficult to dissociate cause from effect.
sentences.cn: 往往很难把因果截然分开.

sentences.en: It seems harder and harder for the president to dissociate himself from the scandals that surround Mr. Galdos.
sentences.cn: 看来总统越来越难以从缠绕盖尔多斯先生的丑闻中脱身。

sentences.en: It's difficult to dissociate the man from his position.
sentences.cn: 一想到这个人,就很难不同时想起他的职位.

sentences.en: Mr Kimura cannot be persuaded to dissociate himself entirely from such thugs.
sentences.cn: 木村先生不能将自己和这群暴徒完全区分开来.

sentences.en: She tried to dissociate herself from the bigotry in her past.
sentences.cn: 她力图使自己摆脱她以前的偏见.

sentences.en: She tried to dissociate the two events in her mind.
sentences.cn: 她试图从思想上将这两件事分开。

sentences.en: You must dissociate these two events!
sentences.cn: 你必须把这两件事分开!

trans.tran_en: If you dissociate yourself from something or someone, you say or show that you are not connected with them, usually in order to avoid trouble or blame
